de.undercouch.citeproc.helper.oauth

Class OAuth1

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.undercouch.citeproc.helper.oauth.OAuth1
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OAuth
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ZoteroOAuth

    public class OAuth1
extends Object
implements OAuth
    Performs OAuth authentication. Very minimal implementation, only used for Zotero authentication currently.
    Author:
    Michel Kraemer

    • Method Detail

      • requestTemporaryCredentials

        public Token requestTemporaryCredentials(URL url,
                                         OAuth.Method method)
                                  throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: OAuth
        Requests temporary credentials. This is the first step in the OAuth authentication process. The temporary credentials are used to generate an authorization URL.
        Specified by:
        requestTemporaryCredentials in interface OAuth
        Parameters:
        url - the URL from which the temporary credentials should be requested
        method - the HTTP request method
        Returns:
        the temporary credentials
        Throws:
        IOException - if the request was not successful
        RequestException - if the server returned an error
        UnauthorizedException - if the request is not authorized

      • requestTokenCredentials

        public Token requestTokenCredentials(URL url,
                                     OAuth.Method method,
                                     Token temporaryCredentials,
                                     String verifier)
                              throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: OAuth
        Requests token credentials. This is the third step in the OAuth authentication process after the user has authenticated the app using the authorization URL and the temporary credentials created with OAuth.requestTemporaryCredentials(URL, Method)
        Specified by:
        requestTokenCredentials in interface OAuth
        Parameters:
        url - the URL from which the token credentials should be requested
        method - the HTTP request method
        temporaryCredentials - the temporary credentials
        verifier - the verification code returned by the OAuth server
        Returns:
        the token credentials
        Throws:
        IOException - if the request was not successful
        RequestException - if the server returned an error
        UnauthorizedException - if the request is not authorized

      • request

        public Response request(URL url,
                        OAuth.Method method,
                        Token token)
                 throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: OAuth
        Sends a request to the server and returns an input stream from which the response can be read. The caller is responsible for consuming the input stream's content and for closing the stream.
        Specified by:
        request in interface OAuth
        Parameters:
        url - the URL to send the request to
        method - the HTTP request method
        token - a token used for authorization (may be null if the authorization is not required for this request)
        Returns:
        a response
        Throws:
        IOException - if the request was not successful
        RequestException - if the server returned an error
        UnauthorizedException - if the request is not authorized

      • request

        public Response request(URL url,
                        OAuth.Method method,
                        Token token,
                        Map<String,String> additionalHeaders)
                 throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: OAuth
        Sends a request to the server and returns an input stream from which the response can be read. The caller is responsible for consuming the input stream's content and for closing the stream.
        Specified by:
        request in interface OAuth
        Parameters:
        url - the URL to send the request to
        method - the HTTP request method
        token - a token used for authorization (may be null if the authorization is not required for this request)
        additionalHeaders - additional HTTP headers (may be null)
        Returns:
        a response
        Throws:
        IOException - if the request was not successful
        RequestException - if the server returned an error
        UnauthorizedException - if the request is not authorized
